Throws:

copy

public static void copy(java.io.File path,
                        java.io.File toPath,
                        boolean overwrite)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Copy a file or directory (recursively) to a destination path. Generally it behaves as a standard posix command line copy tool.

If the input path is a directory and the destination path already exists, the input directory will be copied as a subdir to the destination directory.

If the destination directory does not exist it will be created and the contents of the input dire3ctory will be copied here.

Note: The recursive copy is not transactional. If an error occurs halfway through the copy, the already copied files will not be removed.

Parameters:
path - the file or directory to copy from.
toPath - the destination file or directory.
overwrite - if false this method will throw a FileAlreadyExistsException if the operation will overwrite an existing file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was an error copying the file(s)
FileAlreadyExistsException - if overwrite=false and the method is about to overwrite an existing file.

move

public static void move(java.io.File source,
                        java.io.File dest,
                        boolean overwrite)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Move a file with the same semantics as the standard Unix move command.

In contrast to the standard Java File.renameTo(java.io.File) this method does extensive sanity checking and throws appropriate exceptions if something is wrong.

This method will cause quite a bit of stat dancing on the file system, so don't use this method in performance critical regions.

If dest is a directory source will be moved there keeping its base name. If dest does not exist source will be renamed to dest.

Parameters:
source - a writable file or directory
dest - either an existing writable directory, or non-existing file with existing parent directory
overwrite - if true and dest exists and is a regular file it will be deleted before moving source here
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if either source or the parent directory of dest does not exist
FileAlreadyExistsException - if dest exists and is a regular file. If overwrite is true this exception will never be thrown
FilePermissionException - if source or dest is not writable
InvalidFileTypeException - if the parent of dest is a regular file
java.io.IOException - if there is an unknown error during the move operation

move

public static void move(java.io.File source,
                        java.io.File dest)
                 throws java.io.IOException
As move(File, File, boolean), with overwrite set to false.

java.io.IOException

baseName

public static java.lang.String baseName(java.lang.String filename)
Deprecated. use File#getName) instead.

Return the base name of a file. For example

"autoexec.bat" = baseName ("C:\autoexec.bat") "fstab" = basename ("/etc/fstab")

Parameters:
filename - the filename to extract the base name for.
Returns:
file's basename.

download

public static java.io.File download(java.net.URL url,
                                    java.io.File target,
                                    boolean overwrite)
                             throws java.io.IOException

Download the contents of an URL and store it on disk.

if target argument is a directory the file will be stored here with the basename as extracted from the url. If it points to a non-existing file it will be written to a file with that name.

If the target argument points to an already existing file and overwrite == false a FileAlreadyExistsException will be thrown. Otherwise the file will be overwritten.

Parameters:
url - where the data should be downloaded from.
target - the place to store the downloaded data. This can be either a file or a directory.
overwrite - whether or not to overwrite the target file if it already exist.
Returns:
the resulting file.
Throws:
java.net.ConnectException - if there was an error opening a stream to the url.
java.io.IOException - if there was an error downloading the file or writing it to disk.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the input arguments are null.

download

public static java.io.File download(java.net.URL url,
                                    java.io.File target)
                             throws java.io.IOException
See download(java.net.URL, java.io.File, boolean). This method invokes the detailed download method with overwrite=false

Parameters:
url - URL pointing to the data to be downloaded
target - the place to store the downloaded data. A file or directory.
Returns:
the resulting file.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there was an error downloading the file or writing it to disk.
